action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A person is skiing down a snowy hill.
continue

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A group of people skiing down a mountain.
continue

This is my DESCRIPTION: A person is skiing down a snowy hill.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the person skiing alone or with others?
continue

This is my DESCRIPTION: A group of people skiing down a mountain.
QUESTION: Is the person skiing alone or with others? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
ANSWER: The person is skiing with others.
continue
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any trees in the background?

QUESTION: Are there any trees in the background? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
ANSWER: Yes, there are trees in the background.
continue
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any buildings in the background?

ANSWER: Yes, there are trees in the background.

ANSWER: No, there are no buildings in the background.

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any ski lifts visible in the image?

ANSWER: No, there are no buildings in the background.

ANSWER: No, there are no ski lifts visible in the image.

ANSWER: Yes, there are other people in the image besides the person skiing.

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any other skiers in the image?

ANSWER: Yes, there are other people in the image besides the person skiing.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
DECISION: same image

loss
